name: Double Lexicographically Minimum
statement: You are given a string $$$s$$$. You can reorder the characters to form a string $$$t$$$. Define $$$t_{\mathrm{max}}$$$ to be the lexicographical maximum of $$$t$$$ and $$$t$$$ in reverse order. Given $$$s$$$ determine the lexicographically minimum value of $$$t_{\mathrm{max}}$$$ over all reorderings $$$t$$$ of $$$s$$$. A string $$$a$$$ is lexicographically smaller than a string $$$b$$$ if and only if one of the following holds: $$$a$$$ is a prefix of $$$b$$$, but $$$a \ne b$$$; in the first position where $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$ differ, the string $$$a$$$ has a letter that appears earlier in the alphabet than the corresponding letter in $$$b$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 10^5$$$) â€” the number of test cases. Descriptions of test cases follow. The first and only line of each test case contains a string $$$s$$$ ($$$1 \leq |s| \leq 10^5$$$). $$$s$$$ consists of only lowercase English letters. It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$|s|$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$10^5$$$.
outputFormat: For each test case print the lexicographically minimum value of $$$t_{\mathrm{max}}$$$ over all reorderings $$$t$$$ of $$$s$$$.

sampleTests.input:
12
a
aab
abb
abc
aabb
aabbb
aaabb
abbb
abbbb
abbcc
eaga
ffcaba
sampleTests.output:
a
aba
bab
bca
abba
abbba
ababa
bbab
bbabb
bbcca
agea
acffba
